description: The Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) degree is offered through departments in the Colleges of Behavioral and Health Sciences, Liberal Arts, and Education. This degree requires a minimum of 120 semester hours. Each student must complete a major, General Education requirements, and the B.A. degree requirements which include 6 semester hours of foreign language. Consult the sections for the individual departments in this catalog for specific major requirements. For current degree plans, please click on the following link: Degree Plans.

The Department of Management offers majors in Management, Supply Chain Management, and Entrepreneurship. Our programs are designed to provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary to succeed in a wide range of careers.

The Bachelor of Fine Arts degree with a concentration in Studio provides a strong professional degree for those students who plan to pursue art as a career and/or continue their education at the graduate level. The B.F.A. is recognized as the professional degree for artists. The degree requires students to complete a strong core of general education, in addition to extensive study in areas such as drawing, painting, sculpture, ceramics, printmaking, photography, or graphic design. Students wishing to be considered for admission to the B.F.A. program must pass a portfolio review.
Accreditation status: The Department of Art and Design is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).

description: The Bachelor of Music (B.M.) degree in Music, Instrumental Music Education Concentration, is designed for students who desire to teach instrumental music (band or orchestra) in public schools. This degree program prepares students for the rigorous demands of instrumental music education through a combination of applied music study, music theory, music history, and pedagogical methods specifically tailored for instrumental music. Graduates of this program will be equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary to create a positive and effective learning environment for K-12 instrumental music students. The curriculum includes extensive practical experience through student teaching and participation in various instrumental ensembles. Upon successful completion of the program and passing appropriate licensure exams, graduates will be eligible for Tennessee teacher licensure in Instrumental Music (K-12).

Do you love science, but you’re not sure which specific scientific field you want to pursue? The B.S. in Science, General Science Concentration provides students with a broad scientific background by combining courses in biology, chemistry, geology, and physics. Students are given the flexibility to choose courses that best suit their interests and career goals. This program is suitable for students who wish to pursue a career in science or pursue additional degrees, such as an M.D. or an M.S. in science education. This program provides a solid foundation for those interested in a career in science. Graduates will be well-prepared to pursue employment in various scientific fields, including research, laboratory work, or science education. The flexibility of the General Science Concentration also allows students to prepare for professional programs like medical school, dental school, or pharmacy school.

The Bachelor of Science in Nursing (B.S.N.) program prepares graduates for entry into professional nursing practice and provides the foundation for graduate study. Graduates are prepared as generalists to deliver patient-centered care and function as members of an interdisciplinary health care team, utilizing evidence-based practice, quality improvement, and informatics. Graduates are prepared for leadership roles, professional growth and development, and health care policy. The B.S.N. is a pre-licensure degree program.
Accreditation status: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing at Middle Tennessee State University is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education, 655 K Street, NW, Suite 750, Washington, DC 20001, 202-887-6791.

description: The Bachelor of Social Work (B.S.W.) program at Middle Tennessee State University is committed to preparing students for competent generalist social work practice, graduate studies in social work, and lifelong learning. The B.S.W. program is a generalist social work program designed to provide students with the knowledge, values, and skills necessary for entry-level professional social work practice in a wide variety of settings. The program also prepares students for graduate social work education. The overall mission of the B.S.W. program is to prepare students to be ethical and competent generalist social work practitioners who are committed to social and economic justice and human rights for diverse populations. Students will develop and apply knowledge, values, and skills to empower individuals, families, groups, organizations, and communities through effective interventions, policy analysis, advocacy, and research.
Accreditation status: The Middle Tennessee State University Bachelor of Social Work Program is accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE).

description: Are you ready for a high-flying career? As a major aerospace hub, Middle Tennessee State University has become a premier choice for students aspiring to work in the aerospace industry. From flight and air traffic control to maintenance and administration, MTSU prepares students for a variety of aerospace careers. The Maintenance Management concentration is designed for students interested in the airline or general aviation maintenance industry or in aerospace manufacturing and repair. The program includes hands-on experience in the classroom and hangar settings at the MTSU Aerospace campus and internships and co-ops with industry partners. Graduates of the program are prepared for careers in a rapidly growing industry, including: Aircraft Maintenance and Repair, Maintenance Management, Quality Control/Assurance, Aircraft Manufacturing, Avionics Technician.
Accreditation status: The B.S. in Aerospace degree, with concentrations in Flight, Air Traffic Control, Aerospace Technology, and Maintenance Management, is housed in the Department of Aerospace, which is accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI).

description: MTSU's Animation program trains students in the art and craft of creating animated films and interactive experiences. Students gain broad exposure to all aspects of the animation pipeline, from story and design to modeling, animation, lighting, texturing, rigging, compositing, and rendering. We emphasize a hands-on approach to learning in a studio-like environment. Small classes and dedicated faculty ensure that students receive individual attention and feedback on their projects. The Animation curriculum prepares students for a career in various areas of the animation industry, including 2D animation, 3D animation, motion graphics, visual effects, and game development. Animation program graduates can pursue careers in a wide range of industries including film, television, video games, advertising, and education. Possible job titles include: 2D Animator, 3D Animator, Motion Graphics Designer, Visual Effects Artist, Technical Artist, Storyboard Artist, Character Designer, Concept Artist, Rigger, Texture Artist, Lighting Artist, Render Wrangler.

As one of the world's premier programs in audio engineering and music production, the Audio Production program prepares students for careers in the audio arts. Housed in the College of Media and Entertainment, the program is unique in its integration of the artistic and scientific elements of audio, with courses ranging from electronic music and critical listening to the physics of sound and advanced digital audio workstation operation. Graduates work as engineers, producers, and technicians in recording studios, live sound venues, broadcast facilities, and other media operations. The Audio Production program provides students with a solid academic foundation and the practical skills needed to be successful in the professional audio world. Core courses focus on topics such as acoustics, critical listening, studio recording techniques, mixing, mastering, and the business of audio. A wide range of electives are available for students to specialize in areas such as live sound, post-production audio for film and video, game audio, electronic music production, and broadcast audio.

The Concrete Industry Management (CIM) program at MTSU is a four-year bachelor of science degree program that began in 1996 to address the need for a management-oriented program specifically designed for the concrete industry. The CIM program has been extremely successful because of the unique partnership between the university, industry, and the patron organizations. The curriculum addresses all aspects of the concrete industry and prepares graduates for careers in management, sales, marketing, production, and quality control. Graduates are in high demand across the United States. Many receive multiple offers from top concrete companies.

Concentration name: Science and Technology, Business and Entrepreneurship
description: Fermentation Science is an interdisciplinary program that draws from the fields of biology, chemistry, and microbiology, along with business and agriculture. Through classroom study and hands-on experiences, students will learn to apply scientific principles to the controlled growth and activity of microorganisms to produce fermented products. Students will develop skills in the areas of analytical chemistry, microbiology, sensory evaluation, and process control. MTSU’s Fermentation Science Program is unique in its breadth, encompassing beer, wine, spirits, foods, and industrial fermentation, and in its blend of technical and business courses. Students completing the Fermentation Science program will be prepared to enter the workforce in a variety of fermentation industries including brewing, distilling, winemaking, food, and industrial applications. Students can also prepare for graduate school or professional school programs.

Middle Tennessee State University's Mechatronics Engineering Bachelor of Science degree is the first of its kind in Tennessee. Mechatronics combines mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, computer science, and control engineering, resulting in a synergistic system that integrates these fields. As automation and smart technologies rapidly become the norm across industries, Mechatronics Engineering plays a vital role in designing, implementing, and maintaining them. Our program emphasizes hands-on learning, design projects, and industry partnerships to provide students with practical skills and real-world experience. With a Mechatronics Engineering degree from MTSU, you'll be at the forefront of innovation. You will learn to design, build, and maintain intelligent systems, robots, and automated processes. This interdisciplinary field opens doors to diverse career paths in manufacturing, aerospace, automotive, healthcare, and more. Our graduates are well-prepared to tackle complex challenges and contribute to technological advancements. Core areas of study include: Mechanical Systems, Electrical Systems, Control Systems, Computer Programming, Robotics, Automation.
Accreditation status: The Bachelor of Science in Engineering Technology degree with a concentration in Mechatronics Engineering is accredited by the Engineering Technology Accreditation Commission of ABET, http://www.abet.org.

description: MTSU's Department of Recording Industry, founded in 1973, is recognized as one of the oldest and most respected programs globally and is consistently ranked among the nation's top music business schools by Billboard. Housed in the university’s College of Media and Entertainment, the department offers students a hands-on, professionally oriented curriculum. It provides state-of-the-art facilities, including seven recording studios, two mixing labs, a mastering lab, and a new live sound studio. Students also have opportunities for internships and other experiential learning activities. The faculty includes Grammy-nominated engineers, producers, and songwriters. Alumni have a strong record of success, routinely working on Grammy- and Dove Award-winning projects, with several inducted into the TEC Awards Hall of Fame.
Program name: Recording Industry, B.S. (Commercial Songwriting | Music Business)

description: The Video & Film Production program at Middle Tennessee State University has been preparing students for careers in the television and film industries for more than 40 years. Our graduates are equipped with technical and aesthetic skills to create visual stories and produce a wide array of content for broadcast, cable, streaming services, and the big screen. You'll gain a strong foundation in visual storytelling, critical analysis, aesthetic development, professional ethics, and research and writing. The curriculum also provides experience in all aspects of production from concept to distribution, including camera operation, lighting, sound recording, editing, and post-production. You'll choose one of two concentrations: Live Production, which trains students to work in multi-camera studio and remote environments; or Filmmaking, which prepares students for careers in single-camera production environments like narrative and documentary film. Both concentrations emphasize collaboration and hands-on learning with industry-standard equipment and facilities.
Program name: Video & Film Production, B.S. (Live Production and Filmmaking concentrations)

Concentration name: Aviation Management, Flight Dispatch, Maintenance Management, Professional Pilot, Aerospace Technology
description: MTSU's Aerospace Department is the largest and most comprehensive university-level aviation program in Tennessee and one of the largest in the nation. It boasts a diverse fleet of aircraft, state-of-the-art simulators, and dedicated faculty, offering a rich educational experience for aspiring aviation professionals. The Bachelor of Science in Aerospace prepares students for a variety of aviation careers. Depending on the chosen concentration, graduates can pursue roles as professional pilots, aviation managers, flight dispatchers, maintenance managers, aerospace technologists, or unmanned aircraft systems operators. Graduates are highly sought after by airlines, corporate flight departments, fixed-base operators, government agencies, and other aviation-related businesses.
Accreditation status: Accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI), ensuring high standards of education and industry relevance.
Program name: Aerospace B.S. (Aviation Management, Flight Dispatch, Maintenance Management, Professional Pilot, Technology only)

description: Industrial-Organizational (I-O) Psychology is the scientific study of working and the application of that science to workplace issues facing individuals, teams, and organizations. The I-O major at MTSU prepares students with the knowledge and skills needed for successful careers in a variety of fields (human resources, talent acquisition, training and development, organizational development, etc.) or for graduate studies in I-O psychology, human resources, or other related disciplines. The B.S. in I-O Psychology provides students with foundational knowledge about human behavior at work with a focus on psychological principles and research methods. You’ll learn how to apply psychological principles to help organizations improve productivity, employee satisfaction, and overall effectiveness. The curriculum emphasizes critical thinking, data analysis, and problem-solving skills, preparing you for a wide range of careers or further education in the field.

Supply chain management is the management of the flow of goods and services and includes all processes that transform raw materials into final products. It involves the active streamlining of a business's supply-side activities to maximize customer value and gain a competitive advantage in the marketplace. Supply chain management involves a company's efforts to develop and implement supply chains that are as efficient and economical as possible. The Supply Chain Management program at MTSU focuses on sourcing, production, and distribution management, with particular emphasis on logistics and transportation. Students completing this degree will be prepared for a wide variety of supply chain and logistics careers in manufacturing, retail, transportation, and health care industries.
Accreditation status: The Jennings A. Jones College of Business is proud to be accredited by AACSB International – The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business. This accreditation represents the highest standard of achievement for business schools worldwide. Less than 5% of the world's 16,000 business programs have earned AACSB accreditation.

Concentration name: Live Production, Media Sales, Sports Media
description: The Media Management program prepares students for a variety of careers in the converging media industries. Students study leadership, management, economics, and law as they apply to radio, television, motion pictures, music, news, and digital media industries. The curriculum provides a balance between theoretical and practical application and includes a robust internship program. Our graduates are prepared to contribute to the financial health and creative success of media organizations throughout the world. The Media Management program offers three concentrations: live production, media sales, and sports media.

Program name: Aerospace B.S. (Flight Dispatch, Unmanned Aircraft Systems only)

description: The Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering Technology with an Electromechanical Concentration focuses on applying principles of electricity, electronics, and mechanics to design, develop, and test electromechanical systems. With state-of-the-art facilities and experienced faculty, students gain hands-on experience in areas such as robotics, automation, and control systems. The program prepares graduates for careers in industries such as manufacturing, aerospace, and defense, where they will be responsible for designing, testing, and maintaining complex electromechanical systems.

Environmental science is an interdisciplinary field that integrates physical, biological, and information sciences to study the environment, and the solution of environmental problems. It is a broad field of study that includes a wide range of disciplines. Students who study environmental science learn how to identify, evaluate, and solve environmental problems; how to prevent future environmental problems; and how to manage and conserve natural resources. Students also learn how to communicate scientific information to a variety of audiences, including policymakers and the public. With a degree in environmental science, you can pursue careers in government agencies, non-profit organizations, and private industry, working to protect and improve the environment.

MTSU's Forensic Science B.S. degree is designed for students seeking careers in forensic science or wishing to continue their education in graduate or professional programs in forensic science, medicine, chemistry, or molecular biology. The curriculum includes courses from Forensic Science, Biology, Chemistry, Mathematics, Criminal Justice, and Psychology. The program has concentrations in Forensic Chemistry and Forensic Biology. The Forensic Science curriculum is focused on the application of scientific principles and techniques for the purpose of justice. The program offers hands-on experience through labs and research opportunities, including an optional internship. Students in the program develop critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills necessary for success in forensic science and related fields. In addition, students have the opportunity to work alongside faculty on research projects and participate in student organizations related to forensic science.

The Bachelor of Music (B.M.) in Music with a Music Industry Concentration is the choice for students desiring a career in the professional music world with an emphasis on the business and technical aspects of music. This program combines professional-level musical training with courses in music business, recording industry, and other business areas. Students pursuing this concentration should have a solid musical background on an instrument or voice and a desire to learn about the inner workings of the music industry. Admission to the School of Music and a successful audition on an instrument or voice are required before students can be accepted into this concentration. Upon graduation, students are prepared for careers as artist managers, booking agents, promoters, copyright administrators, music publishers, record label executives, and similar positions.

A Bachelor of Science degree in Textiles Merchandising and Design prepares students for careers in the fashion, textile, and apparel industries. There are two concentrations: Apparel Design and Fashion Merchandising. The Apparel Design concentration provides a broad-based knowledge of apparel design development, illustration, and construction, including computer-aided design, technical design, product development, and creative problem-solving. The Fashion Merchandising concentration provides knowledge in the functional areas of the textile, apparel, and home furnishings industries, including sourcing, product development, global marketing, supply chain management, retailing, visual merchandising, and entrepreneurship. Students majoring in Textiles Merchandising and Design are required to complete an internship. The department provides students with a variety of opportunities to become involved in extracurricular activities and organizations such as student fashion shows, career trips, and the Textile and Merchandising Society.
Program name: Textiles Merchandising and Design (Fashion Merchandising and Apparel Design)

description: Our Interior Architecture (B.S.) is an FIDER/CIDA-accredited professional program that prepares graduates for entry-level positions in the interior design profession and for further study at the graduate level. The curriculum covers the knowledge and skills necessary to produce safe, functional, and aesthetically pleasing interior environments that meet the human need for shelter and well-being. The curriculum is developed to meet the standards of the Council for Interior Design Accreditation (CIDA) and the National Architectural Accrediting Board (NAAB), preparing students for a variety of career options, including residential and commercial interior design, space planning, facilities management, and furniture design.
Accreditation status: FIDER/CIDA-accredited professional program; curriculum developed to meet the standards of the Council for Interior Design Accreditation (CIDA) and the National Architectural Accrediting Board (NAAB).

description: The accounting major prepares students for a variety of careers in both public and private accounting, as well as for graduate study. Accountants perform numerous financial activities including auditing, preparing income tax returns, developing and administering accounting information systems, and managing and controlling financial data for organizations. MTSU's Department of Accounting provides a state-of-the-art curriculum, excellent professors with diverse backgrounds and experiences, and many opportunities to engage with professionals in accounting through an active Beta Alpha Psi chapter and other professional organizations. The Professional Accountancy program allows students to complete both a BBA and Master of Science in Accounting (M.Acc.) in five years and meets the 150-hour requirement for CPA licensure.
Accreditation status: The MTSU Jones College of Business and its Accounting Department are accredited by AACSB International.

description: Actuarial science involves the application of mathematical and statistical methods to assess risk in insurance, finance and other industries and professions. Actuaries are problem solvers and strategic thinkers with a deep understanding of financial security systems, their design and their operation. They use quantitative skills to analyze data to estimate the probability and likely cost of future events. The Bachelor of Science in Actuarial Science degree program at UT Dallas provides comprehensive training in the fundamental mathematics, statistics and financial theory required for success in the actuarial profession. The curriculum is designed to prepare students for the Actuarial Society's professional examinations and to equip them with the analytical skills needed for successful careers.

The Aviation Management Concentration is for students who want to develop management and operations expertise in the aviation and aerospace industries. With a strong business and aviation focus, the Aviation Management program prepares students for leadership roles in various sectors of the aviation industry, including airport management, airline operations, air cargo, and fixed-base operations (FBOs).
Accreditation status: The Aerospace program is separately accredited by Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI).

description: The Bachelor of Science degree in Aerospace with a concentration in Flight Dispatch is designed to prepare students for careers as aircraft dispatchers. Flight dispatchers are an integral part of an airline’s operations and, along with the pilot, are legally responsible for the safety of each flight. The dispatcher analyzes weather conditions, evaluates aircraft performance, computes the amount of fuel needed for each flight, determines the safest and most economical flight plan, and ensures that all aspects of a flight operation comply with FAA regulations. The dispatcher remains in contact with the flight crew throughout the flight to provide updated weather information and make any necessary changes to the flight plan. They also assist the flight crew in emergency situations. The program includes the academic training required to take the FAA Aircraft Dispatcher written and practical exams. Upon successful completion of these exams, students are issued an Aircraft Dispatcher Certificate. This certificate is required to work as an airline dispatcher.
Accreditation status: The Aerospace Department is accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI).

description: This program offers a B.S. degree in Aerospace with a concentration in Maintenance Management. The Maintenance Management concentration is designed for individuals who desire a four-year degree with significant emphasis on aviation maintenance principles and practices coupled with critical management skills. This curriculum provides the academic coursework necessary to prepare students for leadership and management positions within the aviation industry. Students who successfully complete the required coursework and pass the FAA Airframe and Powerplant examinations are eligible for consideration for the optional 30 hours of academic credit through credit by exam.
Accreditation status: The Department of Aerospace is accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI).

description: The Professional Pilot Concentration is a Bachelor of Science (B.S.) degree program that provides students with the academic and flight training required to become professional pilots. It is an FAA Part 141 approved program that offers students the ability to earn multiple FAA certificates and ratings to include: Private Pilot Certificate, Instrument Rating, Commercial Pilot Certificate (single and multi-engine), and Certificated Flight Instructor (CFI). Successful graduates of the program are eligible for the FAA Restricted-ATP (R-ATP) certificate with 1,000 hours flight time.
Accreditation status: FAA Part 141 approved program

description: MTSU's Aerospace Technology concentration focuses on preparing students for careers in the aerospace industry that require knowledge of maintenance, manufacturing, and general technical applications. The curriculum emphasizes the application of scientific and technological knowledge related to the aerospace environment. Graduates are prepared for a variety of roles within the aerospace industry including technical management, quality assurance, research and development, and production.

The Aerospace, B.S. with a concentration in Unmanned Aircraft Systems Operations provides students with the academic foundation to pursue a wide range of career opportunities within the UAS industry, including flight operations, data analysis, payload operations, and business management. Students learn about the fundamental principles of UAS flight, navigation, and control, as well as the regulatory framework surrounding UAS operations. The curriculum emphasizes hands-on experience through laboratory exercises and flight training, preparing students for success in this rapidly evolving field.
Accreditation status: Accredited by Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI)
Program name: Aerospace, Unmanned Aircraft Systems Operations Concentration, B.S.

description: MTSU's Aerospace professional program prepares students for careers in the aviation and aerospace industries. With seven concentrations, the program offers a variety of educational and career paths. The Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) Technology concentration is for students who are interested in careers involving the design, development, and application of unmanned aircraft systems and their components. This concentration provides a solid foundation in the science and engineering of unmanned aircraft systems. Graduates are prepared for careers in the UAS industry as researchers, developers, and operators of UAS systems. The program consists of a total of 120 credit hours.
Accreditation status: The Aerospace Department is accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI).
Program name: Aerospace, Unmanned Aircraft Systems Technology Concentration, B.S.

description: Agribusiness encompasses the business aspects of food, fiber, and environmental systems. From producers to consumers, agribusiness applies business principles in a variety of related fields. At MTSU, the Agribusiness program offers an outstanding education focusing on management, marketing, finance, policy, and other business applications relevant to the agribusiness industry. An Agribusiness degree prepares students for a wide range of careers in agriculture, food, finance, policy, and environmental sectors. Some potential careers are: Farm Management, Agricultural Marketing, Lending, Policy Analysis, Environmental Management, Commodities Brokerage, and many more.

Concentration name: Equine Science, Livestock/Meat Science, Pre-Veterinary Medicine
description: The Animal Science B.S. program is for students who love animals and want to make a difference in the lives of animals and humans. The program includes the study of animal physiology, nutrition, reproduction, genetics, and health. Students will gain hands-on experience working with a variety of animals, including horses, cattle, sheep, goats, and swine. The program prepares students for careers in animal agriculture, veterinary medicine, animal research, and other animal-related fields. Graduates are well-prepared for roles in areas such as animal breeding, animal health, animal nutrition, and farm management. The curriculum covers both theoretical knowledge and practical skills, ensuring students are ready for the challenges of a dynamic industry. Additionally, students have opportunities to participate in internships, research projects, and extracurricular activities such as judging teams and student organizations, further enhancing their educational experience.

Anthropology is the scientific study of humankind in all times and places. It is a broad field, making it an excellent major for students who are fascinated by people and culture and who seek to understand a variety of societies, both past and present. The curriculum is designed to give students a comprehensive background in the four major subfields of anthropology: cultural anthropology, archaeology, biological anthropology, and linguistic anthropology. Students are also trained in qualitative and quantitative research methods appropriate to these subfields. Graduates with a B.A. or B.S. in Anthropology are prepared for entry-level professional positions in a wide array of fields, including cultural resource management, museums, non-profit organizations, and government agencies. The program also provides a strong foundation for students who plan to pursue graduate studies in anthropology or related fields such as public health, international relations, library science, or law.

Concentration name: Art Education K-12 Teacher Licensure Concentration
description: The Art Education, K-12 Licensure program leads to a Bachelor of Science degree in Art and prepares candidates to teach art in elementary, middle, and high schools. Graduates of the program are eligible for the Tennessee Teacher License, Apprenticeship License (Professional Teaching License). Students are immersed in a balance of coursework designed to develop the knowledge, skills, and dispositions necessary to teach art in public and private schools. Emphasis is placed on studio competencies, art historical knowledge, contemporary art issues, professional practices, and effective teaching methodologies for K-12 settings. Students complete professional education coursework and comprehensive art studio courses from across the art disciplines. Art Education courses provide instruction in classroom management, content-specific methodologies, lesson/unit planning, assessment, and the use of technology to enhance teaching and learning.
Accreditation status: MTSU's teacher licensure programs are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Art Education, Art Education K-12 Teacher Licensure Concentration, B.S.

description: MTSU's Bachelor of Science (B.S.) or Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) in Art with a concentration in Art History provides a foundation in the visual arts with a strong emphasis on the history and theory of art. Students explore art and architecture from ancient to contemporary periods, gaining critical thinking skills, research abilities, and a deep understanding of cultural contexts. The curriculum prepares students for graduate studies, museum careers, art dealing, art criticism, and other related fields.

The graphic design concentration provides a professional education built on a foundation of intellectual, aesthetic, and technical skills necessary to compete in the contemporary design field. Students are challenged to develop creative problem-solving skills and critical thinking while gaining a comprehensive understanding of current and emerging media in a changing global culture. The curriculum promotes social and environmental responsibility, professional ethics, and leadership. Graduate students may concentrate in a studio area or visual culture studies. The master's program is a flexible program structured to accommodate a wide variety of individual student goals. The program has produced working artists, designers, art historians, and teachers.
Accreditation status: Accredited by the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD)

description: The Bachelor of Fine Arts (B.F.A.) degree in Studio Art provides students with an immersive experience in the practice, theory, and history of art. It prepares students for successful careers as professional artists, for graduate study, and for a variety of careers in the visual arts field. Undergraduate students pursuing the B.F.A. in Studio Art choose one of the following concentrations: Ceramics, Drawing, Graphic Design, Illustration, Painting, Photography, Printmaking, or Sculpture. The B.F.A. in Studio Art is the most intensive undergraduate degree offered by the Department of Art and Design. It provides an opportunity for students to develop a body of work in a concentration area that demonstrates a high level of technical and conceptual sophistication. Students are challenged to develop a mature vision through critical dialogue with faculty and peers. Graduates of the program will have a deep understanding of contemporary art practices and theory, along with the skills necessary to pursue their artistic goals.

The Department of Art and Design offers two undergraduate degrees: a Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) and a Bachelor of Science (B.S.). The B.A. degree provides students with a broad background in the visual arts with general education courses outside of the major. The B.S. degree focuses on a professional education, allowing for more studio coursework and fewer general education courses. Both degrees prepare students for careers in art and design or for graduate study.

The department offers 11 concentrations including ceramics, graphic design, illustration, photography, painting, printmaking, sculpture, and visual arts education. The Visual Arts concentration, B.A. or B.S., provides students with a broad general background in the visual arts and the flexibility to pursue individual interests. Students may specialize in two or more media areas, such as painting and sculpture, or create a multidisciplinary course of study. In addition, the Visual Arts concentration provides ideal preparation for the Master of Arts in Visual Arts (MAVA) program at MTSU.
Accreditation status: MTSU is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC). The Department of Art and Design is accredited by the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).

description: The B.S. in Biology provides a broad foundation in the biological sciences. The curriculum is flexible enough to permit students to customize their program of study to prepare for graduate school, health-related professional programs, or immediate employment. Our graduates are competitive for admission to medical, dental, optometry, pharmacy, veterinary, and other health-related professional schools. Our graduates are also qualified for graduate study in a wide array of biological fields. Employment opportunities exist in various areas, including federal, state, and local agencies (e.g., Tennessee Wildlife Resources Agency, Tennessee Department of Environment and Conservation, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, National Park Service, etc.), environmental consulting firms, zoos and aquaria, natural history museums, and pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and other industries. Students also gain valuable real-world experience through internships with agencies such as the TWRA, TDEC, and local zoos and aquaria, as well as with local businesses and industries.

A Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Chemistry at Middle Tennessee State University provides a comprehensive curriculum that emphasizes a fundamental understanding of chemical principles and practical laboratory skills. The program prepares students for various career paths in science, industry, government, and education, or for advanced studies in chemistry or related fields. With a strong focus on hands-on learning, research opportunities, and modern instrumentation, students gain the expertise necessary to tackle complex chemical challenges and contribute to scientific advancements. The program offers two concentrations: General Chemistry and Forensic Chemistry. Students also have the option to pursue a professional track certified by the American Chemical Society (ACS) for a more rigorous and research-intensive experience, which is highly recommended for those planning to attend graduate school or seeking advanced positions in industry.
Accreditation status: Certified by the American Chemical Society (ACS)

description: Chemistry majors in the Teacher Licensure (MTeach) Concentration prepare students for a career as a high school chemistry teacher. Students gain teaching experience through fieldwork in local schools, working with experienced chemistry teachers, and ultimately fulfilling the requirements for licensure in Tennessee.

Concentration name: Business Education, International Business, General Business
description: The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Commerce at Middle Tennessee State University prepares graduates to excel in diverse business environments. This comprehensive program provides students with a strong foundation in core business principles, including management, marketing, finance, accounting, and economics. The curriculum emphasizes critical thinking, problem-solving, and effective communication, equipping students with the essential skills needed for successful careers in various industries or for pursuing advanced studies. With optional concentrations in Business Education, International Business, and General Business, students can tailor their degree to their specific career interests, ensuring they are well-prepared for the challenges and opportunities of the modern business world.

The Bachelor of Arts and Bachelor of Science in Communication prepares students for a wide variety of careers in fields such as broadcasting, journalism, advertising, public relations, public information, marketing, education, and human resources. The program also provides a strong foundation for graduate studies in communication and related fields. Students will learn how to communicate effectively, think critically, solve problems, conduct research, and adapt to changing environments. The curriculum emphasizes both theoretical understanding and practical application, with opportunities for internships and experiential learning.

The Communication Studies major focuses on the study of communication processes, messages, and meaning. It helps students understand human interaction through the exploration of various theories and contexts. Students develop strong critical thinking, research, writing, and speaking skills that are essential in nearly every profession.
The Communication, Culture and Social Influence concentration helps students understand how people are influenced by and interact with their social world and culture. Students in this concentration learn to evaluate, analyze, and apply communication theories related to social influence and culture. Graduates are prepared for careers that involve understanding and influencing attitudes, beliefs, and behaviors across various cultural contexts.
Program name: Communication, Culture and Social Influence Concentration, B.S./B.A.

description: The Organizational Communication concentration gives students the skills and knowledge to analyze, manage, and solve communication-related challenges within professional settings. Students learn about leadership, teamwork, negotiation, and cross-cultural communication, preparing them for careers in human resources, training and development, corporate communication, and non-profit management. Graduates are equipped to facilitate effective communication and foster positive organizational cultures.

MTSU's Computer Science Bachelor of Science degree offers a concentration in Artificial Intelligence. This concentration provides students with a strong foundation in computer science and specialized knowledge and skills in artificial intelligence. This includes areas such as machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing, computer vision, and robotics. Graduates will be prepared for careers in AI development, data science, machine learning engineering, and research, as well as for further graduate studies in AI or related fields.
Program name: Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence Concentration, B.S.

description: The Business Applications Concentration is for students wishing to apply computing to the solution of business problems and integrate computing with other business disciplines. This concentration also provides an excellent background for graduate study in business or computer science.
Program name: Computer Science, Business Applications Concentration, B.S.

description: Cybersecurity is a rapidly growing field with an increasing demand for skilled professionals. MTSU’s Bachelor of Science in Computer Science with a concentration in Cybersecurity Systems prepares students for careers in this vital area. Students in the Cybersecurity Systems Concentration learn to apply principles of computer science to design, develop, and implement secure computer systems. They develop strong analytical and problem-solving skills to protect information systems from cyber threats, ensuring data confidentiality, integrity, and availability. This program covers topics such as network security, cryptography, secure software development, digital forensics, and ethical hacking. Graduates are well-prepared for roles as cybersecurity analysts, security engineers, incident responders, and other cybersecurity-related positions in various industries, government agencies, and consulting firms.
Program name: Computer Science, Cybersecurity Systems Concentration, B.S.

description: The Computer Science B.S. program is designed for students who want to develop strong programming and technical skills. The Professional Computer Science concentration provides an in-depth study of algorithms, data structures, operating systems, software engineering, and artificial intelligence. This concentration prepares students for a wide range of careers in software development, data science, cybersecurity, and more. Students in the Professional Computer Science concentration will learn to: Design, develop, and test software systems. Analyze and solve complex computational problems. Apply data structures and algorithms effectively. Understand and implement operating system principles. Develop skills in artificial intelligence and machine learning. Collaborate on software projects using industry-standard practices.
Program name: Computer Science, Professional Computer Science Concentration, B.S.

description: The Concrete Industry Management (CIM) program at MTSU is a one-of-a-kind degree program that gives students a four-year Bachelor of Science degree in a professional program that will prepare them for a management career in the concrete industry. The mission of the CIM program is to produce broadly educated, articulate graduates grounded in basic business management, who are knowledgeable of concrete technology and are able to manage people and systems within the concrete industry.
Program name: Concrete Industry Management, Concrete Contracting Concentration, B.S.

description: As the only program of its kind in the world, the Concrete Industry Management (CIM) program at Middle Tennessee State University has become the gold standard for producing graduates in the concrete industry. Students are prepared for a variety of careers in the concrete industry including production, sales, and service. All students enrolled in the CIM program are required to complete a minor in Business Administration. In addition to a broad education and general business courses, CIM students take a wide range of concrete-specific courses, which include subjects such as concrete properties, concrete construction, testing, materials, production, sales, and management. Experiential learning is a key component of the CIM program. Students complete two paid summer internships with CIM Patrons, one of the two national organizations that support the CIM program. Most students also choose to participate in the CIM student organization, which offers additional opportunities for learning and networking. For more information, visit the Department of Concrete Industry Management.
Program name: Concrete Industry Management, Production, Sales and Service Concentration, B.S.

description: MTSU's B.S. in Construction Management with a Commercial Construction Management Concentration focuses on the commercial and industrial sectors of the construction industry. This includes commercial buildings, industrial facilities, heavy-highway construction, utilities infrastructure, and related fields. The program emphasizes both management and technology, preparing students to lead and innovate in a dynamic global industry. Our curriculum provides a strong foundation in construction methods, materials, structural systems, project management, estimating, scheduling, safety, and business principles relevant to the construction industry. Graduates are equipped with the technical skills and leadership abilities to manage complex construction projects from conception to completion. The program aims to develop highly competent construction professionals capable of effective decision-making, problem-solving, and ethical practice within the construction domain.
Accreditation status: The Construction Management program at MTSU is accredited by the American Council for Construction Education (ACCE). ACCE is recognized by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) as the accrediting agency for baccalaureate and master's degree programs in construction education.
Program name: Construction Management, Commercial Construction Management Concentration, B.S.

description: The Construction Management Program prepares students for a management career in the construction industry. With an average of over 200 students per year and four full-time faculty members, it is one of the largest programs of its type in Tennessee. The program offers five concentrations: Commercial, Concrete Industry Management, Electrical, Mechanical, and Land Development/Residential Building Construction Management. Our graduates find careers as project managers, estimators, field engineers, superintendents, and material suppliers in both the private and public sectors. The program provides the students with an in-depth understanding of how to plan, organize, and control the entire construction process, from start to finish. Our curriculum focuses on a core of construction management principles, coupled with a solid business background, and then branches into specialized areas through the concentrations.
Accreditation status: The Construction Management Program is accredited by the American Council for Construction Education (ACCE).
Program name: Construction Management, Land Development/Residential Building Construction Management Concentration, B.S.

description: The university’s Bachelor of Science in Criminal Justice program is designed for students interested in careers in policing, corrections, courts, law, and other related fields. The program teaches students how to apply sociological theories and methods to the analysis of crime and criminal behavior. Graduates are prepared for a variety of careers in both the public and private sector and for advanced studies in graduate or law school.

The new Cybersecurity Management, B.S. program, offered by the Department of Information Systems and Analytics within the Jones College of Business, is designed to bridge the gap between technical expertise and business acumen, offering students a holistic education that prepares them for leadership roles in the rapidly evolving field of cybersecurity. Students will gain a deep understanding of cybersecurity principles, risk management, data privacy, and compliance, while also developing essential business skills such as strategic planning, financial analysis, and project management. Graduates of the Cybersecurity Management program will be well-equipped to protect organizations from cyber threats, implement robust security measures, and navigate the complex regulatory landscape of the digital age. The B.S. program is designed to meet the growing demand for professionals who possess both strong technical skills and a comprehensive understanding of business operations and strategy. The curriculum focuses on the intersection of cybersecurity and business, preparing students to manage and implement cybersecurity strategies within an organizational context. Students will take courses that cover topics like network security, ethical hacking, digital forensics, cloud security, risk assessment, and legal and ethical issues in cybersecurity. The curriculum is designed to give students a comprehensive understanding of both the technical and managerial aspects of cybersecurity.

The Elementary Education program at Middle Tennessee State University prepares graduates to teach grades K-5. The program is designed to provide students with the knowledge, skills, and dispositions necessary to be effective teachers in diverse elementary school settings. An Elementary Education major prepares students to teach in grades K-5, and students seeking licensure may choose one of three concentrations: Academic Concentration, Arts and Humanities, or STEM. This program emphasizes practical experiences in a variety of elementary school settings, culminating in a full semester of student teaching.
Accreditation status: Accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

description: Are you ready to respond to natural disasters, terrorist attacks, and other emergencies? Do you want to work to prevent these events, protect critical infrastructure, and help communities recover after incidents occur? Our B.S. in Emergency Management and Homeland Security prepares you for a challenging and rewarding career in this vital field. MTSU's Emergency Management and Homeland Security (EMHS) program is one of only a few in the nation. It provides students with a broad and comprehensive understanding of all-hazards mitigation, preparedness, response, and recovery strategies and policies associated with emergencies and disasters. Students learn the tools and techniques utilized in the field, including geographic information systems (GIS), intelligence analysis, and exercise design. Our program also offers you the opportunity to pursue an accelerated B.S. to M.P.S. (Master of Professional Studies) program with a concentration in Strategic Leadership.
Program name: Emergency Management and Homeland Security, B.S.

description: MTSU's B.S. in Engineering Technology with a concentration in Computer Engineering Technology is designed to develop the technical and managerial skills needed to prepare students for careers in the rapidly changing technological world. Students will learn the design, implementation, and maintenance of computer systems. This includes areas such as computer hardware, software, networking, and embedded systems. The Computer Engineering Technology program has laboratory-intensive courses that give students the hands-on experience needed for success in the workplace. Graduates will have the opportunity to work in various fields, including computer manufacturing, telecommunications, automation, and industrial control. In addition, graduates will be well-prepared to pursue advanced degrees in engineering or technology.
Program name: Engineering Technology, Computer Engineering Technology Concentration, B.S.

description: The Electromechanical Engineering Technology concentration focuses on the integration of mechanical and electrical systems. Students develop expertise in areas such as robotics, automation, control systems, and manufacturing processes. This concentration prepares graduates for roles in industries requiring a blend of mechanical and electrical engineering skills.
Accreditation status: The Engineering Technology B.S. program is accredited by the Engineering Technology Accreditation Commission of ABET, https://www.abet.org.
Program name: Engineering Technology, Electromechanical Engineering Technology Concentration, B.S.

description: This program prepares students for positions in engineering technology and provides skills to enter industries that require individuals to apply scientific and engineering principles to the design, analysis, and implementation of mechanical and manufacturing systems. Emphasis is placed on problem solving skills by combining theory and applications in areas such as product design, thermal fluid systems, controls, instrumentation, system integration, manufacturing processes, and quality control.
Accreditation status: The Bachelor of Science degree program in Engineering Technology is accredited by the Engineering Technology Accreditation Commission of ABET, http://www.abet.org.
Program name: Engineering Technology, Mechanical Engineering Technology Concentration, B.S.

description: Do you love to write? The Creative Writing program at MTSU offers you the chance to hone your skills in fiction, poetry, creative nonfiction, playwriting, and screenwriting. Faculty members are award-winning published writers dedicated to teaching and mentoring students, and our small class sizes allow for individualized attention. Students enjoy a vibrant literary community with many opportunities to interact with visiting writers, take part in readings and open mics, and publish their work. The Creative Writing program offers students a comprehensive education in the craft and art of writing across genres while also providing a solid foundation in literature. Graduates pursue careers as writers, editors, teachers, and communicators in various fields, or continue their education in graduate programs such as the M.F.A.

The English B.A. with an English Language Linguistics Concentration includes coursework in the history of the English language, language structure, modern grammar, discourse analysis, and dialects. Students in this concentration may focus on applications of linguistics such as sociolinguistics, psycholinguistics, second language acquisition, or writing systems, as well as take advantage of hands-on opportunities in the linguistics lab. Graduates with this concentration may pursue careers in English language teaching (especially ESL/EFL), technical writing, editing, or publishing, or they may go on to graduate study in linguistics, speech pathology, or related fields.
Program name: English, English Language Linguistics Concentration, B.S./B.A.

description: Students in the English major with the Literary Studies concentration acquire a broad understanding of literary traditions and genres and develop essential critical reading and analytical writing skills. The curriculum includes courses in British, American, and World Literatures, literary theory, and professional writing. Students in the concentration select an area of specialization from the following: American Literature, British Literature, World Literature, or Critical Theory.

The Literature and Culture concentration within the English B.A. program offers students a solid foundation in the study of literature and culture, building critical reading and writing skills while preparing students for a variety of professions including education, law, business, and library and information science. Courses survey major authors, genres, and literary periods, and allow students to explore a range of topics including race, gender, and class; film studies; and the natural environment.
Program name: English, Literature and Culture Concentration, B.A.

description: The English, Secondary English Teacher Licensure Concentration, B.S./B.A. provides students with a thorough background in English studies and prepares them for licensure as English teachers in grades 6-12. The program integrates coursework in English literature, language, and writing with professional education courses and extensive clinical experiences, including student teaching. Graduates are equipped to create engaging and effective learning environments, foster critical thinking and literacy skills, and meet the diverse needs of secondary English students.
Program name: English, Secondary English Teacher Licensure Concentration, B.S./B.A.

Concentration name: Pre-Physical Therapy, Pre-Occupational Therapy, Strength and Conditioning, Allied Health
description: Do you enjoy an active lifestyle and want to work with people? A B.S. in Exercise Science will provide you with the knowledge, skills, and abilities to enter various health and fitness careers or prepare for professional programs such as Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Cardiac Rehabilitation, Physician's Assistant, Athletic Training, Strength & Conditioning, Corporate Wellness, and other Allied Health professions. Our program emphasizes evidence-based practice and a hands-on learning approach. We provide students with opportunities for practical experience and exposure to various professional settings through internship opportunities, research, and community engagement. You can choose from four concentrations including: Pre-Physical Therapy, Pre-Occupational Therapy, Strength and Conditioning, and Allied Health.

Concentration name: Business Finance, Financial Institutions, Financial Planning, Real Estate
description: Finance is the study of creating and managing money. The MTSU Finance program provides students with the theoretical and practical knowledge they need to pursue exciting careers. MTSU offers an interdisciplinary curriculum that enables students to gain the skills needed to enter a variety of financial careers including commercial banking, investments, insurance, corporate finance, financial planning, real estate, and government. Additionally, students can take electives in the areas of Business Finance, Financial Institutions, Financial Planning, and Real Estate. The Finance B.B.A. program offers students an opportunity to obtain the required knowledge to sit for professional designations such as Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), Certified Financial Planner (CFP), and Chartered Property Casualty Underwriter (CPCU).
Accreditation status: Accredited by AACSB International

description: The Department of Economics and Finance offers a major in Finance (B.B.A.) with concentrations in Financial Management, Real Estate, and Financial Planning. Real Estate concentration students focus on the acquisition, financing, management, and marketing of real property. Real estate has long been an attractive area for investment and career opportunities. As a real estate major, you will study real estate law, valuation, brokerage, financing, development, and investment management. Career opportunities exist in residential and commercial real estate sales, appraisal, property management, mortgage lending, real estate development, and portfolio management. The finance-real estate concentration also offers elective courses in various topics suchs as derivatives, risk management, and international finance.
Accreditation status: Accredited by AACSB International – the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.

description: Forensic Science is a multidisciplinary field that combines natural sciences with law enforcement to provide crucial scientific evidence for legal proceedings. In this program, students will learn to apply scientific methods and techniques to analyze physical evidence, interpret findings, and present expert testimony in court. Through hands-on experiences, students will develop critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills essential for a successful career in forensic science. The curriculum covers a wide range of topics, including forensic chemistry, biology, toxicology, trace evidence analysis, crime scene investigation, and forensic pathology. Students will gain practical experience through laboratory work, internships, and research opportunities, preparing them for diverse roles in law enforcement agencies, crime laboratories, and government organizations.

The Bachelor of Science degree in Geosciences is designed to prepare students for careers or for graduate study in the geosciences. Geosciences is the study of the Earth, its materials, processes, products, and history. Earth's processes and products include minerals, rocks, soils, water, oceans, atmosphere, and life forms, as well as the dynamic forces that shape the planet's surface and interior. Earth scientists use the tools and methods of geology, geography, physics, chemistry, biology, and mathematics to investigate earth systems, understand Earth's past and present, and predict its future. Geosciences students may choose one of four concentrations: Geology, Environmental Geosciences, Physical Geography, or Earth Science Education. Coursework includes a combination of classroom, laboratory, and field-based learning experiences.

Middle Tennessee State University's Bachelor of Science in Global Studies and Human Geography offers students an understanding of global connections, the human experience, and human-environment interactions. The Global Studies concentration offers a broad, interdisciplinary curriculum in international affairs, cultures, and global issues, preparing students for careers in diplomacy, foreign service, international business, and non-governmental organizations.
Program name: Global Studies and Human Geography, Global Studies Concentration, B.S.

description: Human Geography explores human interaction with the natural environment and the economic, political, and cultural forces affecting people and places. Global Studies focuses on global issues and the changing relationships between societies, cultures, and institutions. Both concentrations help students develop critical perspectives on global and local issues that affect humanity.
Accreditation status: MTSU is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC) to award associate, baccalaureate, master’s, specialist, and doctorate degrees. Degrees from programs are not individually accredited.
Program name: Global Studies and Human Geography, Human Geography Concentration, B.S.

description: From the dawn of civilization to the present, history records the ideas and actions of humankind. As a History major at MTSU, you'll delve into the past to discover how events and issues have shaped our present and will influence our future. You'll analyze primary and secondary sources, learn about historical methodology and historiography, and hone your critical thinking, research, and writing skills. Students can choose to concentrate in American History or World History.

As a History major at MTSU, you'll delve into the past to better understand the world around us. With four concentrations to choose from, you can focus on the areas that most interest you and prepare you for your career goals. This program offers students the opportunity to earn a B.A. or a B.S. in History with a concentration in History 6-12 Teacher Licensure. This concentration allows students to pursue a degree in History while also meeting the requirements for teacher licensure in Tennessee. Students interested in this concentration should contact the College of Education for information regarding specific course requirements and the application process for the teacher education program. Students are responsible for meeting all requirements for program admission, retention, and completion as outlined in the MTSU Undergraduate Catalog.
Program name: History, History 6-12 Teacher Licensure Concentration, B.S./B.A.

description: The Bachelor of Arts/Science in History with a concentration in Public History prepares students for a career in the dynamic field of public history. Public history is a broad array of activities, professions, and scholarship undertaken by people with historical training who work to engage the public with history. Public historians serve a diverse public and work in a variety of settings from museums and archives to state and national parks, historic sites, historical societies, and government agencies. Public historians conduct oral histories, process archives, curate exhibits, manage historic sites, develop interpretive programs, and provide public education. With this degree, you will learn practical skills that allow you to bring history to a public audience. You will learn to conduct historical research, apply historical knowledge and methods, engage in historical interpretation, and communicate history to a variety of audiences. You will also learn practical skills relevant to careers in public history, including archive and museum management, historic preservation, and oral history. This concentration is a good choice for students interested in careers in museums, archives, historic preservation, and cultural resource management. Our faculty are active scholars and experienced public historians who bring their expertise to the classroom.

Middle Tennessee State University’s Horse Science program offers one of the most comprehensive university-level equine programs in the country, attracting students from across the United States and abroad. The program includes both a two-year Associate of Science and a four-year Bachelor of Science degree, with concentrations in Equine Industry or Science within the Bachelor of Science degree. Students gain real-world experience through classes taught in our university barn facilities. Through internships and active participation in competitive events, students apply their knowledge and skills in the equine industry. Located in Murfreesboro, TN, MTSU is centrally located in one of the largest horse centers in the country, giving students unique opportunities and access to the heart of the horse industry.

The Exercise Science Concentration prepares students for careers in clinical settings such as cardiac rehabilitation, strength and conditioning, corporate wellness, health and fitness clubs, personal training, and a variety of other health-related fields. In addition, the Exercise Science Concentration provides an excellent foundation for graduate study in Exercise Science, Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Chiropractic, and Medical School. The Exercise Science Concentration has two tracks: Pre-Physical Therapy and Exercise Science. While both tracks provide the prerequisite coursework for graduate school, the Pre-Physical Therapy track is designed for students desiring to enter a Doctor of Physical Therapy program. The Exercise Science track is designed for students desiring to enter a master's degree program in Exercise Science or work in a health/fitness related field.
Program name: Human Performance, Exercise Science Concentration, B.S.

description: The Textiles, Merchandising and Design major with a concentration in Fashion Merchandising will prepare students for careers in the dynamic global fashion industry. Students will gain knowledge and skills in areas such as fashion trends, product development, global sourcing, retail buying, visual merchandising, and entrepreneurship. The curriculum combines business principles with creative applications to provide a comprehensive understanding of the fashion supply chain, from design to consumer. Graduates will be equipped to pursue diverse roles in retail, wholesale, and related fashion sectors. As a student in the Fashion Merchandising concentration, you will gain skills and knowledge in a wide array of areas within the fashion industry, including: Fashion trend analysis; Product development and sourcing; Retail buying and planning; Visual merchandising and display; Marketing and promotion; E-commerce and digital merchandising; Supply chain management; Textile science; Fashion history and culture; Sustainability in fashion.
Program name: Human Sciences, Fashion Merchandising Concentration, B.S.

description: Interior Architecture is the professional discipline of designing human environments. Interior Architecture focuses on both the practical and aesthetic considerations of building and renovating interior spaces. The curriculum provides students with a strong foundation in design, drawing, building systems, and materials and methods, all within the context of preparing students to sit for professional licensure. Graduates of the Interior Architecture program work in many areas, including commercial and residential design, furniture design, lighting design, sustainable design, and historic preservation.
Accreditation status: The Interior Architecture (B.S.) program leading to the Bachelor of Science in Interior Architecture is accredited by the Council for Interior Design Accreditation (CIDA), 2060 Division Avenue, SW, Grand Rapids, MI 49507-1621. Visit the CIDA website at www.accredit-id.org for more information.
Program name: Human Sciences, Interior Design Concentration, B.S.

description: The B.S. in Human Sciences with a concentration in Nutrition and Food Science (NFS) prepares students for a variety of careers related to food, nutrition, and health. Students learn about food preparation, food safety, human nutrition, food science, and hospitality management. Graduates are prepared for careers in food service management, community nutrition, food industry, and government agencies. The NFS program is approved by the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics (AND) as a Didactic Program in Dietetics (DPD).
Accreditation status: Approved by the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics (AND) as a Didactic Program in Dietetics (DPD).
Program name: Human Sciences, Nutrition and Food Science Concentration, B.S.

description: The Bachelor of Arts in Humanities combines the study of world cultures, literature, philosophy, and religion with a broad knowledge of human activity and creativity. Humanities students gain invaluable insight into complex ideas, critical thinking skills, and an awareness of social, economic, and political issues throughout history. You’ll be prepared for a wide variety of career options or continued study in graduate school including law, international affairs, human resources, public relations, social work, journalism, business, management, or library science.

Industrial-Organizational (I-O) psychology is the scientific study of working and the application of that science to workplace issues facing individuals, teams, and organizations. I-O psychology is a growing field that applies psychological principles and research methods to optimize human potential in the workplace. I-O psychologists are scientists and practitioners who specialize in human behavior in the workplace. They are trained in the scientist-practitioner model, meaning they have expertise in both conducting research and applying research findings to real-world problems. The focus of I-O psychology is on increasing workplace effectiveness and employee well-being. As an I-O Psychology major, you will learn how to apply psychological principles to enhance individual and organizational performance in the workplace. You will develop critical thinking, research, and analytical skills necessary for success in various professional roles or for pursuing graduate studies in I-O psychology. Specific topics include personnel selection, performance management, training and development, leadership, motivation, organizational culture, and occupational health psychology. An I-O Psychology B.S. provides excellent preparation for entry-level positions in human resources, talent acquisition, organizational development, training, and data analysis. The major also serves as a strong foundation for pursuing graduate degrees in I-O Psychology, Human Resources, Business Administration, and related fields.

The B.B.A. in Information Systems provides students with the fundamental knowledge and skills needed to manage, design, develop, secure, and deploy information technology and systems. Graduates are highly sought after in the private and public sectors and assume positions such as business systems analysts, project managers, database administrators, network administrators, information systems auditors, and more. A degree in Information Systems is relevant to nearly every industry and profession, from health care to financial services to entertainment. Information Systems students are critical thinkers who understand both business and technology. Because businesses rely on computing technology to manage and organize data, improve efficiency, and develop innovative products and services, Information Systems graduates are highly valued. Our graduates are problem solvers who are able to bridge the gap between technical experts and business executives.
Accreditation status: The Department of Information Systems and Analytics, located in the Jones College of Business, is AACSB accredited.

description: The Integrated Studies, Applied Leadership (B.S.) concentration prepares students to apply principles and strategies of leadership and organizational dynamics in professional settings. This program is for students who have obtained an associate degree or have accumulated significant credit hours (60+) and desire to complete their bachelor's degree. Students completing this program will be equipped with critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills applicable to various careers, including business, non-profit, government, and education.
Program name: Integrated Studies, Applied Leadership Concentration, B.S.

description: The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Integrated Studies (IS) provides a flexible, interdisciplinary program of study designed for students whose educational goals cannot be met by traditional majors. The IS major provides students with the critical thinking, communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills necessary to be successful in the workforce and for career advancement. The Public Safety Concentration is designed for students seeking entry-level positions or advancement in various public safety fields such as homeland security, emergency management, law enforcement, corrections, and fire services. Students completing the concentration will gain knowledge and skills in areas such as emergency planning, homeland security strategies, public safety administration, and critical incident management. The curriculum is interdisciplinary, drawing upon courses from Criminal Justice, Sociology, Psychology, Political Science, and other relevant departments.
Program name: Integrated Studies, Public Safety Concentration, B.S.

Concentration name: Animation, Audio Production, Design, Game Development, Photography, Video and Film Production, Web Development
description: The Interactive Media (IM) program at MTSU is an interdisciplinary Bachelor of Science degree offered through the College of Media and Entertainment. IM merges the creative power of art, audio, video, photography, web, and animation with the technical skills to create professional interactive content across many industries. Students gain broad exposure to interactive media concepts, theories, technologies, and applications, and also delve into a specific concentration related to their interests. With this degree, graduates are prepared to pursue a wide range of careers in dynamic and rapidly evolving industries. The IM program is part of the Department of Media Arts within the College of Media and Entertainment, which offers many student opportunities through state-of-the-art facilities and equipment (including a virtual production lab), professional internship opportunities, student organizations, and a faculty of highly qualified scholars and industry professionals.

The Interior Architecture, B.S. program combines an understanding of the built environment and human interaction within that environment with an artistic eye for aesthetics and design. This bachelor of science degree program prepares students for the wide range of challenges and exciting opportunities that exist within the profession of interior design and architecture today.
